Package: org.jlab.analysis

[Groovy] Class FiducialCuts

    • org.jlab.analysis.FiducialCuts 
    • @groovy.transform.CompileStatic
class FiducialCuts
extends java.lang.Object

      Implements Stefan Diehl's (sdiehl@jlab.org) fiducial cuts: version 7/23/2020.

      Version:
      1.0
      Authors:
      Matthew McEneaney

      • Methods Summary

          Methods 
          Type Params Return Type Name and description
          protected boolean DC_fiducial_cut_XY(int j, int region, int part_pid)
          Stefan's comments: use the following cut for inbending electrons and all outbending particles j is the index of the particle.
          protected boolean DC_fiducial_cut_theta_phi(int j, int region, int part_pid)
          Stefan's comments: use the following cut for inbending hadrons: j is the index of the particle.
          protected boolean EC_hit_position_fiducial_cut_homogeneous(int j)
          Stefan's comments: EC hit position homogenous cut This is the main cut for PCAL fiducial cut of electrons.
          protected boolean applyCuts(int runnum_, int current_part, int pid_, Event event_, HipoReader reader_)
          Applies RGA fiducial cuts to particle at index current_part in REC::Particle.
          protected int determineSectorDC(int i)
          Determines the sector 1-6 in DC for given particle at index i in REC::Particle bank.
          protected int determineSectorEC(int i)
          Determines the sector 1-6 in ECal for given particle at index i in REC::Particle bank.
          protected void setArrays(HipoReader reader, Event event)
          Fill the arrays at the event level for PCal/ECal and DC hits.
          protected void setLevel(int level)
          Set the level of harshness for fiducial cuts: 0-loose, 1-medium, 2-tight.
          protected void setPCalArrays(HipoReader reader, Event event)
          Fill the arrays at the event level for PCal/ECal hits.
          protected void setTrajArrays(HipoReader reader, Event event)
          Set drift chamber bank arrays at the event level.
          protected void statistics()
          Print out pass/fail statistics by pid for each type of fiducial cut applied.

      • Method Detail

        • protected boolean DC_fiducial_cut_XY(int j, int region, int part_pid)

          Stefan's comments: use the following cut for inbending electrons and all outbending particles j is the index of the particle. Th variable part_pid is needed to assign the correct cut The inbending / outbending flags (see top of this document) have to be set to assign the correct cut

          Parameters:
          j
          region
          part_pid

        • protected boolean DC_fiducial_cut_theta_phi(int j, int region, int part_pid)

          Stefan's comments: use the following cut for inbending hadrons: j is the index of the particle. The variable part_pid is needed to assign the correct cut The inbending / outbending flags (see top of this document) have to be set to assign the correct cut Note: DIM(arrays) = (6,6,3,4) (pid,sector,region,param)

          Parameters:
          j
          region
          part_pid

        • protected boolean EC_hit_position_fiducial_cut_homogeneous(int j)

          Stefan's comments: EC hit position homogenous cut This is the main cut for PCAL fiducial cut of electrons. A cut is performed on v and w. Different versions are available: For SIDIS I use the loose versions, for cross sections I would recommend the medium or tight version.

          Parameters:
          j

        • protected boolean applyCuts(int runnum_, int current_part, int pid_, Event event_, HipoReader reader_)

          Applies RGA fiducial cuts to particle at index current_part in REC::Particle. IMPORTANT: Make sure arrays are already filled by calling setArrays() method at event level before looping particles.

          Parameters:
          runnum_
          current_part
          pid_
          event_
          reader_

        • protected int determineSectorDC(int i)

          Determines the sector 1-6 in DC for given particle at index i in REC::Particle bank.

          Parameters:
          i

        • protected int determineSectorEC(int i)

          Determines the sector 1-6 in ECal for given particle at index i in REC::Particle bank.

          Parameters:
          i

        • protected void setArrays(HipoReader reader, Event event)

          Fill the arrays at the event level for PCal/ECal and DC hits.

          Parameters:
          reader
          event

        • protected void setLevel(int level)

          Set the level of harshness for fiducial cuts: 0-loose, 1-medium, 2-tight.

          Parameters:
          level

        • protected void setPCalArrays(HipoReader reader, Event event)

          Fill the arrays at the event level for PCal/ECal hits. Hits in layers 1, 4, and 7 are required for a full track.

          Parameters:
          reader
          event

        • protected void setTrajArrays(HipoReader reader, Event event)

          Set drift chamber bank arrays at the event level. Hits are required in middle layer of each sector (6,18,36).

          Parameters:
          reader
          event

        • protected void statistics()

          Print out pass/fail statistics by pid for each type of fiducial cut applied.
